column4: I have 3 NIC cards how do I find out which one is eth1 or eth2 etc etc??
If they are different peices of harware, just run ifconfig
It tells you info on each of your cards
yes they are, but they have static ip's
and it wasn't me who set them up so I need a way of telling which one is which..
Do you only need to know which one is active?
no, I need to know which one belongs to the ip given inside /etc/network/interfaces
Run ifconfig. It lists what the IP
I know! but my question is how can I find out what eth1 is on the back of the server!
Oh! You mean which one is which physically!
yes sir, sorry if I was misleading.
Well, assuming only one is plugged into a network, the one with the IP is the one plugged in in the case.
I imagine there's a way to find out which PCI slot each one is in. I don't know it off hand, so I'll try looking around.
yeah that's more less what I wanted. I'm looking around too...
I found lspci, but that seems hard to decipher at a glace.
yup you are on the right track cause someone else suggested that too
i'll just have to decipher it somehow =D
It doesn't list which PCIe slot my network card is in for me. If it's the same for you, it's useless.
If you want to do it in less elegant manner, just pull them all out one at a time.
yup, that's what I'm doing now. Thanks guys.
Too bad it came to that. Oh well.
some things don't come as easy as other don't they!? =D
